meanings.sent1: She dualizes her tasks by completing half in the morning and the other half in the evening.
meanings.sent2: The mirror dualizes the image, showing both the front and back of the object.
meanings.sent3: The magician dualizes the rabbit, creating two identical bunnies!
meanings.sent4: His personality seems to dualize under stress, revealing conflicting traits.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting skillfully dualizes the scene, capturing both sunrise and sunset in one masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To divide into two parts or aspects.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to dualize its operations, splitting the business into two separate entities.
meanings.sent2: The river dualizes the city, creating distinct neighborhoods on each side of the water.
meanings.sent3: The recipe dualizes the ingredients, making two delicious cakes instead of one!
meanings.sent4: His decision to move abroad dualizes his life, separating his past from his future.
meanings.sent5: The storm's strong winds dualize the tree, breaking it into two halves with a loud crack.
